data.title: Fix Joystick scrolling stuck
data.body: Closes #13300

data.title: Server config: lock gamesettings
data.body:
It would be nice to have an option to lock the game settings (server side), so players can't change the map/speed/crates etc.

For example something like this:
**Server.LockSettings="True"**

No idea if this is possible, thanks in advance.

data.title: Server log: player victorious/lost
data.body:
I'm currently setting up some basics for a matchmaking system, something like Faceit (https://www.faceit.com). It will be an webapplication in PHP and NodeJS.

It would be nice if the server log can returns who is victorious, so I can track who has won and lost (to create my own ranking system).

[2017-05-16T11:15:22] Game started
[2017-05-16T11:16:31] TestingServer has disconnected.
[2017-05-16T11:17:49] TestingServer2 has disconnected.
[2017-05-16T11:17:49] **TestingServer2 is victorious!**
[2017-05-16T11:17:49] No one is playing, shutting down...
[2017-05-16T11:17:49] Starting a new server instance...

Or maybe someone else has a better idea to track this (API?).

Thanks in advance.

data.title: HeliFly.cs activity hangs the game (zero minimum range case)
data.body:
Infinite loop:

A helicopter is very likely to hover over the target when controlled by AI. In this case
* HeliFly.tick() : Try to move towards target evaluates that the helicopter is inside the maximum range of the weapon so it thinks that it may proceed to Attack activity.
* Attack.cs, InnerTick(): However, this one thinks it needs to move, because
```
			if (!Target.IsInRange(self.CenterPosition, maxRange) || Target.IsInRange(self.CenterPosition, minRange)
				|| (mobile != null && !mobile.CanInteractWithGroundLayer(self)))
```

* The first expression correctly evaluates that the helicopter is in maxRange, proceeds to the next expr.
* The second one, evaluates that target is in minimumRange.
* IsInRange is INCLUSIVE and Helicopters with minRange of 0 will think that it needs to move away out of minimum range.
* Then it goes to HeliFly.tick() to move again then comes back to attack because it is within maximum range.

There's nothing that prevents modders having 0 range for helis!
Another thing is that 0 range makes sense when the "helicopter" is an airborne aircraft carrier!

data.title: No attack cursor for most units and harvesters. Impossible to attack.
data.body:
The bug seems to be simply that there is no attack cursor therefore making it impossible to issue the attack command. Instead, only the normal green move cursor is shown and when clicked the unit moves, not attacks, even if an enemy is being hovered over.

Additionally, harvesters cannot be controlled as ore cannot be "targeted" only moved on top of.

Interestingly, aircraft and APCs **can** be given the attack order successfully.

About my system:

```
OS: ArchLinux
Kernel: 4.10.13-1-ARCH
OpenRA: 20170421-1
Mono: Mono JIT compiler version 5.0.0 (Stable 5.0.0.100/9667aa6 Fri May 12 07:20:13 UTC 2017)
```

Seems to have started happening after Mono was upgraded last night.

data.title: Add LocalOffset to HitShapes
data.body:
Would be usefule at least for `Circle` shape, but possibly to the others, too (for modders it would be a bit more convenient to tweak a single offset instead of 2 points on `Capsule` or 2 corners on `Rectangle`, and it could be used to shift the center along the Z axis, too).

Also see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13196#discussion_r116390723

data.title: Remove Duplicate Tiles from d2k Editor
data.body:
Depends on #13297. (Please use the arrakis.yaml from that PR)
This is a ticket for preparing the removal of  duplicate tiles from the editor, as I don't want to bog down the merging of "further polish d2k tileset" even more. This can take a while. 

Help in identifying more duplicate tiles much appreciated! :)

Phase 1 (identify all duplicates)
Phase 2 (modify UpdateRules.cs)
Phase 3 (modify map importer possibly pointing to non-existent tiles)

data.title: Map editor: make certain terrain in multiple tabs available
data.body:
In the map editor we have different categorytabs for different kind of terrain: roads, river, cliffs, etc.

Some of the tiles can be used in several categories. In bridges for example we find bridges for rivers. It would be nice to also have those in the River-category tab.

There are a couple examples of such tiles that allow the user to convert one type of terrain into the other:
- beach becomes cliff (could be both in Beach and Cliffs)
- bridges can be both in Beach, Road and River
- River going into cliff would be nice both in Cliffs and River
- .. any others?

If this would be implemented the I suggest doing them at the very end of a category.

data.title: Force move / Double click move feature for infantries
data.body: Double clicking on the ground in RA1 or force moving infantries with G key in C&C3 or RA3 removed suppression status from infantries and forced them to walk, instead of prone. Useful for controlling commando or tanya to bomb multiple structures quickly or making infantries move away from danger

data.title: RA aircraft can inappropriately land when at ground elevation
data.body:
If you hit "s" stop when an airplane is landing and it is at ground level, it will force land before properly reaching the airstrip.

![aircraft_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22008761/26039306/5be32e3e-38e7-11e7-892c-621cda30cdfe.png)

data.title: Right click joystick scrolling getting stuck
data.body:
I have my mouse set up to right click joystick scrolling (like in generals), however sometimes when issues orders (also with right click), and panning the camera around, the camera seems to randomly start moving one way, and the only way to stop it is to right click, which often means troops end up being sent to the other side of the map.

If it helps, I think it may be something to do with left click too. Immediately left clicking while in a right click joystick move maybe.

I've attached a screenshot of my input settings:

![openrainputsettings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/27823149/26037536/ca7aa62e-38ec-11e7-85f7-8bca99007172.png)

To replicate pretty easily:
1. Enter an openra game.
2. Make sure you have right mouse scrolling set to joystick in input options as in the screenshot.
3. In one quick action, right click + hold, move mouse,  left click while panning, release right click. This needs to be done pretty quickly.
4. Screen will continue panning after right mouse is released.

data.title: Map editor incorrectly reports all money on the map
data.body:
1. Create a new map
2. Place 4 ore tiles like this:
    ![openra 2017-05-14 22-39-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1079123/26037147/27f1d5b2-38f6-11e7-8749-3f5d7944a84b.png)
3. Evidence that the map contains $500 worth of ore
4. Start a game with the created map
5. Place a refinery and order the spawned harvester to harvest this ore
6. Evidence that your harvester is full and there's 1 more unharvested tile left:
    ![openra 2017-05-14 22-35-39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1079123/26037158/74f1223c-38f6-11e7-972c-ce96499edc74.png)
7. Send the harvester to the refinery and evidence that you received $500 worth of ore
8. Send the harvester to grab the ore that's left and send it back to the refinery
9. Evidence that you received $100 worth of ore

Problem: map editor says that there's $500 worth of ore on the map. Harvester's capacity is exactly $500 worth of ore. When the harvester is full, there's still some ore on the map, which means the map has more ore than the map editor actually reports (in my example, it's $600).

Expected behaviour: the harvester collects all the ore on the map OR map editor reports the correct amount of ore on the map ($600).

data.title: Contrail disappears immediately when the unit is dead
data.body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PJb4L7PyyOo&t=26s

I thought something was odd visually and noticed that all the contrail is removed immediately when the contrailer is dead, instead of leaving gradually shrinking bits behind.

data.title: Further polish d2k tileset - continuation
data.body:
Depends on/Hijacks #12868.

- implements Items comments on passability on Bridges and some Sand-Detail terrain.
- fixes the map importer for the terrain tiling error Item mentioned.
- renames and reorders terrain categories: To be uniform (XXX-YYY-Cliff), similar categories adjacent to each other, moves most used categories to top.
- moves tiles into appropriate categories

data.title: IsInWorld check for contrail
data.body:
https://youtu.be/PJb4L7PyyOo

Possible use by aircraft carriers and V3 rockets. When units with contrail is contained in another actor, without IsInWorld check, Update() is still called and causes graphical glitch when they are launched.

data.title: IsInWorld check for contrail
data.body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PJb4L7PyyOo

Possible use by RA2 aircraft carriers and V3 rockets. Without IsInWorld check, the update is called for position (0, 0, 0) when the actor is not in world yet, creating graphical glitch.

data.title: Make animation traits compatible with multiple sprite bodies - part 1
data.body:
This adds a Name identifier field to `WithSpriteBody`, which can be used to make animation traits compatible with multiple sprite bodies.
This is then used to make `WithMoveAnimation` and `WithMakeAnimation` compatible with actors that have more than one sprite body (TS artillery and FS Juggernaut, for example).
This allows to remove the deploy animation code from `GrantConditionOnDeploy`.

Split from #13041, which can also be used as test-case (Juggernaut).

data.title: Allow fixed voxel barrel pitches to be defined in yaml

Split from #13041, which can also be used as test-case.

data.title: Units Disregard Owned Mines 2.0
data.body:
I made a post back in February about [units disregarding mines](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12835). The post was closed because it was going to be fixed in (at the time) the next update. 

Player-owned units still run over player-owned mines (belonging to same person that laid the mines).
![mine](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/26029605/04e63756-3807-11e7-96ad-0df523e94f8d.png)

data.title: Realign turrets before undeploying

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body: Just like actors turn to a specific facing before deploying, their turrets should realign with facing before undeploying, to avoid visual glitches.

data.title: destroy player stuff on disconnect
data.body: is old bad feature, when disconnected player dont clear his buildings and units. pls fix it

data.title: [Idea][Lobby] Show "No of games currently running" somewhere around the server list
data.body:
Leaving the "Started"-filter off by default is - no questions asked - the more favorable alternative to having it set to enabled on default, as it would be both 1) a mess to scroll down each time during high-tide when there are a lot of games running - as well as 2) disadvantageous for other mods as their chance of being seen decreases even further...

Would it be beneficial to instead have (as simple number presented somewhere above/below/next to server list) the number of currently running games indicated (in the veins of RA: 0 (37); TD: 0 (12); D2k: 0 (0))??

That way we could both 1) decrease the number of players coming online and thinking there are no players/games happening at all, just because there are no games "waiting" - not immediately realizing that there are indeed 7 games "running" (not displayed) (this mostly happens during the low-tide hours, when you have a few games running but - most of the time - no games "waiting", giving the impression that there are no games happening at all) - as well as 2) decrease the usage of orabot-commands like "]players" at the same time.

data.title: Work around resolution issues in (legacy) Fullscreen on OSX.
data.body:
Closes #13216.

It turns out that the bug is not with our HiDPI code, but with SDL's handling of (legacy) Fullscreen windows with OSX's display scaling.  Our pre-hidpi releases had their own set of graphical issues in this configuration.

data.title: OpenRA crashing on FreeBSD after fresh install
data.body:
Just installed it ( `#pkg install openra` ), which was the `release-20170421`, the latest stable one, according to the openra website.

The time when the game crashes varies; the first time i did not even get to the modchooser screen, and later i had to pray to not crash before downloading an 8 MB file. It crashed and crashed.

I did not see an `~/.openra/Logs/exception.log` file, but a `~/.openra/Logs/exception-0001-01-01T005718Z.log`. There was no `~/.openra/exception.log` file as specified on the FAQ page. That `exception-0001-01-01T005718Z.log` contained no characters. After deleting the `~/.openra/` directory and running the game to crash a few times, that `exception-0001-01-01T005718Z.log` file or any other `exception*.log` were not generated.

Right before the === message ===, after the `Stacktrace:` part, this was occasionally printed in the terminal: 
`* Assertion at sgen-alloc.c:384, condition *p == NULL' not met`

Also, the message enveloped in === was:
`Got a SIGSEGV while executing native code. This usually indicates
a fatal error in the mono runtime or one of the native libraries 
used by your application.`

And here's a typical crash output from the terminal: https://pastebin.com/3L58XLeV

FreeBSD 11.0-RELEASE-p1, amd64.
